channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: No litter bin, 3rd September
item.description:
No litter bin - you marked this as “fixed”. How is it “fixed” if you have picked up the litter bin that had fallen off the post it was attached to and taken it away, but not replaced it, so leaving the lid attached to the post. Maybe you could have updated the post with “litter bin to be replaced in future” or “litter bin no longer required here, we will be removing the lid” ? Surely it can’t be described as “fixed”? Thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Drive, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street lights Out, 3rd September
item.description:
Street light No9 on Cleveland Row Out along with another on same side of the street.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Cleveland Row, Victoria, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pedestrian crossing flooded, 3rd September
item.description:
Whenever there is sustained or heavy rain, the full length of this crossing is flooded and people either get wet feet, or make a dangerous manoeuvre, shimmying along the pedestrian guard rail. This flooding can be seen in the picture I took today and Google Street View from 2022. It has been unblocked before, but it is only ever a temporary solution. A table should be installed to make this crossing level, like the crossing nearby.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blackwall Lane, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rocking paving slab next to a raised paving slab, 3rd September
item.description:
The middle paving slab is rocking significantly, with the paving slab closest to numbers 48 & 50 being raised. The raised paving slab was reported previously with a temporary repair made. The issue appears to be due to the tree roots extending beneath the pavement (this has occurred beneath the pathway to number 48 and repaired better by the owners than the council contractors)

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 48, Wellington Avenue, Blackfen, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drain., 3rd September
item.description:
This is the drain outside 20 Ebury Street. The drain is currently blocked and floods when it rains. We have had two scheduled drain cleaning sessions in recent weeks - both of which were cancelled/no show. Can you guys please come an attend this blocked drain before winter whether arrives. Thanks!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 18A, Ebury Street, Victoria, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hedge and fence on pavement, 3rd September
item.description:
You have told me this is “fixed”. This is still there. It is therefore “not fixed”. Could you please update as “fixed” when you have dealt with something? Thanks it would be useful if there is some way of the system allowing the original poster to agree if something has been “fixed” rather than having to post another report. Thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Avenue, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Four broken garages!, 3rd September
item.description:
